block.p: The songs that John Lennon wrote helped inspire a generation of activists. ''Give Peace a Chance,'' the antiwar anthem, was recorded during the 1969 Amsterdam Bed-In with Yoko Ono. The couple also used their celebrity to fight for peace with the ''War is Over! (If You Want It)'' poster campaign.

Lennon's activist heirs -- among them U2, Yousou N'Dour, Green Day, Lenny Kravitz and Avril Lavigne -- will release ''Instant Karma: The Amnesty International Campaign to Save Darfur,'' a collection of his songs, tomorrow.
